column5: Niagara Angler Missing    Lindsay Smith(Linz) was last spoken to on October 26. This is very unlike Lindsay to not contact anyone for this length of time including his Mother or Sister. The police have been notified and a missing Persons report filed. We are currently continuing to search for his vehicle. It is very unlikely that he has gone very far as he did not have the funds or gas to go much farther than the niagara region. His boat is still at the storage facility so we know he was not on the water. However thursday the 29th was a warm day and concerns are that he might of went fishing somewhere remote and might have fallen ill or have gotten hurt. There is currently a facebook page set up with as many details that are available and updated hourly. If you wish to view this it can be done by searching "Where is Lindsay Smith" His vehicle is a 1994 Green Jeep Cherokee Sport, license plate AYDW 126, there is a BASS sticker on the rear window. If anyone has any information at all, please contact the Niagara Regional Police.
Just bumping this, we are doing a search tomorrow in the niagara region
Jeez, I hope they find him.  The family must be worried sick.  I'll keep an eye out for his Jeep.  Joey
Sorry to heard that, hope everything is ok. I will keep my eye open for the Jeep.
Thats terrible, I hope he turns up safe and sound.
Pinned this for as long as needed.
Ill keep an eye out,does he strickly fish the niagara area?
Ill keep an eye out from hamilton, and simcoe areas,Ill be fishing the tribs,I also drive the same make and colour jeep.Ill let a few friends know to keep an eye out.hope hes ok.
Thanks Rick
notified a few friends in simcoe area to keep a look out.hope hes alright.
Any update here....sorry if I have missed anything over the past couple of days?  Craig
I got this off the facebook page..    Still missing as far as I can tell.
No new developments on this?
I checked the facebook page... seems like he is still missing.
Lindsay has been found.  Sadly, it is not a happy ending.....  http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=172134962350#!/group.php?gid=172134962350&v=wall
My condolonces to the Smith family and friends. May Lindsey now rest in peace.... Sincerely, John Scholl
Rest in peace buddy! Lindsey was a great friend and a awsome fisherman, always willing to help, We all have closesure now! Tightlines buddy!

My deepest condolences to the family and friends of Linz! If I may ask, how did this unfold, where was he found? I respect his privacy and that of his family and friends and understand if I don't get an answer, but a PM would be nice. Take care everyone! Be strong!
he was found in the welland canal near the allanburg bridge.

Sad news. I remember hearing about this last year. My condolences to his family. Please respect their privacy when posting details. Lindsay could have been any one of us that loved the outdoors. Be safe everyone.
